lead_paragraph: JACK KEMP At a roundtable interview with local journalists yesterday in Los Angeles: ''Rumor aside, we are going to spend a lot of time in California, a lot of money in California. This is a critical state, to the country, to the West, to the Pacific Rim. It is a bridge to Latin America. It is the epicenter of Nafta. Really, it is a microcosm of the country circa the new century, the new millenium. It is close to one-fifth of the U.S. G.N.P. It is the center . . . of this information age global economy. . . .
abstract: Brief excerpt from comments by Jack Kemp on Presidential campaign in California
